default: ^：Old Wong's <color=red>Infinity</color> Kiosk, restocking directly through displacement,
displace_renew: ^Me：Hey, sir. What's this "restocking directly through displacement"?

^Old Wong：Hey, great question! We don't have to contact the manufacturers for restocking, but displace them in. The goods appear directly in store, avoiding bumps and bruises on the way completely! Everything's the best.
^Old Wong：Second-hand? Of course not! Brand new! Directly from factory to the void, from the void to the Old Wong's. Second-hand!
^Me：Sorry, misunderstanding. I mean, I acutally like vintage stuff...
^Old Wong：There isn't any! All brand new! Look, the ink on this label's still shiny...you don't get that on second-hand stuff...
^Me：(Sounds economical. Mr. Wong knows the manufacturing cost of the goods, so it would cost less for him if he restocks through displacement, according to his psychological value.)
^Me: (The manufacturers...directly exchange goods into money. Farewell to dead stock.)
^Me：(The displacement becomes a flawless retail and transportation hub of the world.)
^Me：(...Really, the more perfect it sounds, the more ominous I feel.)
^Old Wong：Come buy often. New things in stock every day!
never_empty: ^Me：Eh, sir, had anyone told you that "never sold out" sounds a bit like...dead stock.
^Old Wong：You people. What could I say. I've already changed the shop's name from "Good Neighbour Old Wong" to "Old Wong ∞," what else do you want?
^Old Wong: Now "never sold out" is also wrong? Dear me...
^Me：But still, what about "always buy, always new?"
^Old Wong: Sounds about right! I'll change it right away.
first_talk: ^Old Wong：Look at my memory! Hey, wrong person. Couldn't have been you. You artists like to keep to yourselves, don't you?
^Me：(Wrong person? Weird. As if I used to show up with somebody else. Should I ask again?)
masaka: ^Me：You can't be talking about Eightminus Tue, my friend with red hair, who's always full of shit?
^Me：(Though I just forgot him yesterday. He doesn't seem to have been around often. But I don't have many friends.)
^Old Wong：Eightminus Tue...red hair... Yes, yes, I know the kid.
^Old Wong：Ha! No mistake. You used to come up here together. How's he doing?
^Old Wong：That's good! Hey, I remember he loved those <color=red>mini books</color>.
^Old Wong: Enough messing around. Painter, don't you want to take a look at what's in stock today?
whom: ^Me：(Somehow I can't let it go.) Who are you talking about?
^Me：I'm just curious. Just a hypothesis, who did you think I'm with?
^Old Wong："Hypothesis!" You artists. Okay, let me think.
^Old Wong：One of them picks and the other pays. OK, satisfied?
^Old Wong: Painter, don't you want to take a look at what's in stock today?
come_buy: ^Old Wong：Come back soon, painter! We're restocking daily, directly from displacement.
